reviews.positive_text: Trouv√© dans l'urgence pour un voyage d'affaire prolong√© en Week-end d'agr√©ment : nous avons cherch√© (et trouv√©) une chambre le jour-m√™me. l'Hotel est id√©alement plac√© au bout de la rue Saint-Jean du P√©rot, au pied de la tour de la lanterne, du parking public (juste derri√®re l'h√¥tel), et √† 5 min √† pied du port. C'est l'endroit parfait si on vient en voiture. La rue de la Monnaie n'est pas beaucoup fr√©quent√©e donc on peut garer la voiture devant l'h√¥tel le temps de d√©charger. Le personnel est adorable, c'est LE point fort de cet h√¥tel : un grand merci √† Alexandre qui a organis√©, t√©l√©phon√©, s'est d√©men√© pour r√©server les meilleurs restaurants (Les Flots, La Yole de Chris...). Ses conseils sur La Rochelle ont magnifi√© notre s√©jour. Un grand parc est √† 5 minutes √† pied, la plage de la Confluence est √† 2 minutes √† pied. Le B√¢timent en pierre de taille est plein de charme avec une cour int√©rieure pav√©e : magnifique pour le petit d√©jeuner ou √† la nuit tomb√©e. La literie est impeccable, nous avons TR√àS bien dormi : les 2 oreillers de formes et de densit√© diff√©rentes permettent de bien se mettre √† l'aise. La clim marche TR√àS bien (m√™me quand la carte est retir√©e). Notre chambre de 17m2 (N¬∞113) est √©quip√©e d'une machine √† caf√© et un mini frigo, un grand bureau et dans 'l'entr√©e' une penderie et des √©tag√®res. La fen√™tre donne une vue adorable sur la cour int√©rieure. La Salle de bain est bien √©quip√©e : on a aim√© la douche √† l'italienne et les produits "Sothy's" de qualit√©.
reviews.negative_text: On voit que l'h√¥tel a √©t√©, dans le pass√©, un tr√®s tr√®s bel h√¥tel (qui m√©rite le qualificatif de "Splendide" de Booking), mais il a beaucoup vieilli (notamment par rapport aux photos sur le site): les moquettes des communs et des chambres sont d√©fraichies, toutes les surfaces ont beaucoup v√©cu. Nous sommes conscients que nous nous y sommes pris √† la derni√®re minute, qu'il ne restait pas beaucoup de chambres et qu'on a pris la chambre la plus basique donc on a certainement pas eu la meilleure, mais l'impression g√©n√©rale c'est que tout para√Æt plut√¥t d√©fra√Æchi. La peinture aux murs, le mobilier, les cadres, les √©quipements. Notre robinetterie √©tait blanche de calcaire, le lavabo est craquel√©, le miroir est √©br√©ch√©, les toilettes sont tellement entartr√©es qu'on a l'impression qu'elles ne sont pas propres. Le spa est en travaux (Septembre 2023) et on esp√®re que les travaux vont aussi concerner le reste de l'√©tablissement, car il a un potentiel fou, et on a vraiment envie d'encenser cet endroit : en tout cas, nous avons envie de lui donner une autre chance, et nous comptons y revenir. Le parking priv√© de l'h√¥tel n'a que 5 places (+2 PMR) accessible par la rue des deux moulins (qui est barr√©e par plots r√©tractables), donc autant dire que c'est plus int√©ressant de se garer au parking public (16‚Ç¨ pour 48h).

reviews.positive_text:
Alexander at afternoon check in and dinner assistance.  He is fabulous.  For him, the property deserves a five star. He really knows the area, he‚Äôs got professionalism with a bit of flair.     He helped us by going over and beyond with restaurant assistance especially for our mobility impaired friend and the other with special diet. 

About 70% of the rooms are renovated so ask for a renovated room if you would like. We had one that was very large and traditional nice decor, but I‚Äôm not a fan of carpets.

We appreciated the large room, but it definitely needs some touchups with paint and so forth. The bed was not great and probably needs to be flipped or replaced.   I‚Äôve slept on worse though so it was fine.

Service was great. And the lack of cleanliness was not because of the staff. I think it was more about just needing refurbished in the areas that still need it.

reviews.positive_text:
Great location, but worth booking a parking spot in advance.   Underground car park is a bit tight for bigger cars but it has a charging point which was a bonus.

Hotel itself is very nice - classic and modern with a nice courtyard, and rooms are nicely decorated and furnished.  Has an air of quiet, understated luxury.

However, what really made the stay GREAT was the staff - we were greeted with helpful info about getting to the car park, guided in there and helped carry our bags, booked a restaurant for us ( their recommendations were very good ! ), and arranged freshly baked gluten-free bread for my wife for breakfast. reviews.positive_text: We stayed at Hotel La Monnaie in Rochelle for 2 nights in August 2023 on our way down to Bordeaux. It's located within easy walking distance of the beach, the local park, all the main eateries and the stunning old port area. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, with a stylish interior, unique artwork and great facilities. All the staff were super friendly and helpful from arranging a parking space, providing a map of the local area and excellent guidance on the main tourist attractions, recommending places to eat and booking restaurants for us. They also replaced the broken safe in our room within a couple of hours of reporting it. The hotel has a private car park and you need to book in advance, however, there is also a public car park within 5 minutes walking distance. The spa was closed for refurbishment whilst we were there (but we were advised of this in advance) so unable to comment. There was a great choice of both hot and cold food at breakfast - you can eat inside or in their beautiful courtyard. Would highly recommend if you're planning a trip to La Rochelle. Thanks for a wonderful visit!
